content:
• Wednesday, January 25, 2012
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) Q4 swings to a profit on record revenue. Earnings jumped 79%...

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) Q4 swings to a profit on record revenue. Earnings jumped 79% Y/Y on solid market share gains its Web 2.0, database, storage and cloud markets. Shares +13.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM
  • MRK

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) trades down after hours following its announcement of a secondary...

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX) trades down after hours following its announcement of a secondary offering with undisclosed terms. Citigroup and Piper Jaffray are acting as joint book-runners. Shares -7.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM
  • RJETQ

    Republic Airways (RJET) pops in the post session after raising its Q4 guidance above Street...

    Republic Airways (RJET) pops in the post session after raising its Q4 guidance above Street estimates, citing stronger results from its Frontier Airlines unit. The company also says it's increasing its Y/Y total revenue per ASM improvement, a key industry metric, to a range between 10% - 11%, up from 8% - 9% previously. Shares +18.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM
  • TER

    More on Teradyne (NYSE:TER): Q4 earnings easily beat estimates as earnings more than doubled on...

    More on Teradyne (NYSE:TER): Q4 earnings easily beat estimates as earnings more than doubled on a one-time tax benefit. The company also boosted its FQ1 outlook, now expecting to earn $0.22 - $0.33 per share on revenue of $360M - $400M. Analysts were looking for $0.15 per share on $296M in revenue. Shares +7.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +8.6%) surged today, and many are left wondering exactly why....

    Research In Motion (RIMM +8.6%) surged today, and many are left wondering exactly why. Short-covering could be a factor, especially with many shorts sitting on large gains. Reuters made note of the hopes surrounding the appointment of Canadian activist investor Prem Watsa to RIM's board, though Watsa's appointment was already known.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • LSI-OLD

    LSI-OLD is now up 7.8% AH after delivering a mixed Q4 report. Investors are focusing on the...

    LSI-OLD is now up 7.8% AH after delivering a mixed Q4 report. Investors are focusing on the chipmaker's Q1 guidance for revenue of $550M-$590M and EPS of $0.09-$0.15, largely above Street estimates of $509.8M and $0.10. 2012 capex is expected to be a fairly modest $65M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of $1.3B-$1.35B and 2012...

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its earnings call (webcast) for Q1 revenue of $1.3B-$1.35B and 2012 revenue of $6.2B-$6.6B; below a consensus of $1.46B and $6.65B. In addition, the flash memory giant forecasts a Q1 gross margin of 39%-42%, below a Q4 level of 42.9%, and forecasts 2012 capex $1.1B-$1.6B. Shares now -8.4% AH. (Q4 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • EFSC

    Enterprise Financial Services (NASDAQ:EFSC) resumes trading down 9% after the company announced...

    Enterprise Financial Services (NASDAQ:EFSC) resumes trading down 9% after the company announced that it will restate its financial statements for 2010 and the first three quarters of 2011. The company claims it inadvertantly overstated income on loans covered by FDIC loss share agreements during those periods.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • VIVO

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -6.4%) had a rough day after reporting FQ1 revenue of $40.3M (+8% Y/Y)...

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -6.4%) had a rough day after reporting FQ1 revenue of $40.3M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.17, missing consensus by $3M and $0.02. The company notes its European diagnostic equipment business "continues to be a drag" on its performance, and that restructuring efforts "will take several more quarters to make a measurable difference."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (GOOG -2%) underperformed the tech sector today on strong volume. Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL)...

    Google (GOOG -2%) underperformed the tech sector today on strong volume. Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) results, and the share gains they imply for iOS relative to Android, could be one reason why, though Google generates plenty of ad revenue from both platforms. Another factor could be the strong backlash to privacy changes announced yesterday, the second major controversy Google has ignited this month (previously).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • MIPS

    More on MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS): FQ2 misses across the board on a decline licensing and...

    More on MIPS Technologies (NASDAQ:MIPS): FQ2 misses across the board on a decline licensing and royalty revenues and a challenging sales environment in its digital home and networking segments. Shares -2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • WDC

    More on SanDisk's Q4: The in-line revenue figure appears to have disappointed those whose hopes...

    More on SanDisk's Q4: The in-line revenue figure appears to have disappointed those whose hopes were raised by Apple's results and other positive datapoints. Gross margin was 42.9%, down 140 bps Q/Q and 80 bps Y/Y thanks to early-quarter weakness in NAND flash pricing. Guidance is likely to be provided during SanDisk's earnings call (webcast). SNDK -4.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • NFLX

    More on Netflix: Its Q4 beat was mostly due to a 220K Q/Q increase in domestic streaming subs,...

    More on Netflix: Its Q4 beat was mostly due to a 220K Q/Q increase in domestic streaming subs, beating guidance for a 1M-1.5M decline, and contributing to a division margin of 10.9%, above a forecast of 8%. Domestic DVD subs fell to 11.2M, near the high end of Netflix's guidance range. International streaming subs grew by 380K to 1.86M, and are expected to reach 2.5M-3.1M in Q1, though a Q1 loss of $108M-$118M is forecast for the division. NFLX +14.3% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • URI

    More on United Rentals' (NYSE:URI) Q4: Rental revenue up 18.5% Y/Y, boosted by a 15.1% increase...

    More on United Rentals' (NYSE:URI) Q4: Rental revenue up 18.5% Y/Y, boosted by a 15.1% increase in the volume of equipment on rent. Recognized $208M from sales of rental equipment, up from $144M last year. For 2012, sees rental rates increasing 5% and anticipates a gain in time utilization of 0.5 percentage points. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +17.3%) confirms it has hired advisers to help it explore a possible merger...

    US Airways (LCC +17.3%) confirms it has hired advisers to help it explore a possible merger with AMR Corp. (AAMRQ.PK). CEO Doug Parker says his past interest in finding a suitor has fueled M&A speculation, but cautions that "as today's results show, US Airways does not need to participate in consolidation." Fuller planes and higher fares helped LCC post a Q4 profit on record revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CCI

    More on Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI): Q4 earnings come in line with estimates on a +17% Y/Y increase...

    More on Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI): Q4 earnings come in line with estimates on a +17% Y/Y increase in FFO. Site rental revenue rose $24M, or 5% Y/Y, to $471M, while site rental gross margin, defined as site rental revenue less site rental cost of operations, jumped $26M, or 8%, over the same period. Shares +1.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ETFC

    More on E-Trade Financial's (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q4: Net new brokerage assets at $1.7B, down 35% Q/Q...

    More on E-Trade Financial's (NASDAQ:ETFC) Q4: Net new brokerage assets at $1.7B, down 35% Q/Q and 39% Y/Y. DARTS of 140,000, marking a 7% Y/Y decline. Reports Tier 1 common ratio of 9.4%, up from 4.8% a year ago. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • CTXS

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS): Q4 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $619M (+17% Y/Y)...

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS): Q4 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $619M (+17% Y/Y) in-line. For full year, revenue of $2.21B (+18%). Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • NFLX

    More on Netflix's Q4: Company expects Q1 revenue of $842M-$877M vs. $847.8M consensus. Expects...

    More on Netflix's Q4: Company expects Q1 revenue of $842M-$877M vs. $847.8M consensus. Expects EPS of -$0.49 to -$0.16 vs. -$0.30 consensus. Sees domestic streaming net adds of 1.1M-1.9M for the quarter, but sees its domestic DVD subscriber base falling by 1.2M-1.8M. NFLX +13.1% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • LSI-OLD

    LSI Logic (NASDAQ:LSI-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $523M (+12% Y/Y) misses...

    LSI Logic (NASDAQ:LSI-OLD): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $523M (+12% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $876M (+47% Y/Y) beats by...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $876M (+47% Y/Y) beats by $18.1M. Shares +12.9% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +2%) gets a boost today from positive comments out of BofA Merrill Lynch, who...

    Valero Energy (VLO +2%) gets a boost today from positive comments out of BofA Merrill Lynch, who reiterated the stock as one of its Top Picks.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • LNC

    Life insurers Lincoln National (LNC -4.5%) and MetLife (MET -2.9%) slide as investors question...

    Life insurers Lincoln National (LNC -4.5%) and MetLife (MET -2.9%) slide as investors question how they can maintain bond portfolio income after the Fed said its benchmark rate would stay low until late 2014. U.S. life insurers hold more than $2T in bonds including corporate debt, munis and mortgage-linked assets, which they use to cover policyholder obligations and generate profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • ETH

    Ethan Allen Interiors (ETH +2.2%) trades higher on a mixed FQ2 report, missing slightly on...

    Ethan Allen Interiors (ETH +2.2%) trades higher on a mixed FQ2 report, missing slightly on revenue but easily beating on a per share basis. Overall earnings rose on higher sales and better margins, as the company continues to make turnaround headway on a reduction in debt and an improving housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • ERIC

    Mobile infrastructure giant Ericsson (ERIC -15.8%) isn't seeing any mercy after delivering a...

    Mobile infrastructure giant Ericsson (ERIC -15.8%) isn't seeing any mercy after delivering a weak Q4 report that featured a 20% Y/Y drop in North American sales, and confirmed existing fears of a soft telecom capex environment. A 640 bps Y/Y drop in Ericsson's gross margin is also a point of concern. Falling in sympathy: ALU -7.5%. JNPR -2.7%. CIEN -2.2%. TLAB -2.8%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • SLAB

    Silicon Laboratories (SLAB -1.6%) dips after its Q4 EPS comes up short of estimates. Net...

    Silicon Laboratories (SLAB -1.6%) dips after its Q4 EPS comes up short of estimates. Net earnings slipped, albeit only slightly, on declining margins, which have been hurt by weak demand as customers grow cautious about building inventory in light of the uncertain global economy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ALLT

    Shares of Allot Communications (ALLT +5.8%) kick up after the firm is cleared by Israel's...

    Shares of Allot Communications (ALLT +5.8%) kick up after the firm is cleared by Israel's Defense Ministry from allegations that it unknowingly passed on surveillance technology to Iran.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • THQIQ

    THQ (THQI -5.3%) shares swoon after the videogame publisher updates its business strategy by...

    THQ (THQI -5.3%) shares swoon after the videogame publisher updates its business strategy by exiting traditional kids' licensed games and focus on core franchises. THQ has made games in the past under license agreements with Disney and Nickelodeon that included properties such as "SpongeBob Squarepants" and "Cars."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • RES

    Oilfield services company RPC (RES -6.5%) is down today after its Q4 came up short of estimates...

    Oilfield services company RPC (RES -6.5%) is down today after its Q4 came up short of estimates due to higher than anticipated employment and raw material expenses. Cost of revenues came in at $268M, or 55.6% of revenues, compared to $174M, or 53.2% in the year prior.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • CLR

    Shares of Continental Resources (CLR +10.3%) jump after the biggest petroleum leaseholder in...

    Shares of Continental Resources (CLR +10.3%) jump after the biggest petroleum leaseholder in North Dakota’s Bakken Shale field reports a 57% Y/Y production increase and 39% growth in reserves. S&P raises its rating on CLR’s debt one notch to BB+, saying it expects production and reserve growth to continue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • UGI

    Gas distributor UGI (UGI -3.3%) trades down after its Q4 misses estimates. The company...

    Gas distributor UGI (UGI -3.3%) trades down after its Q4 misses estimates. The company attributed the results to the impact of significantly warmer than normal weather, which led to weaker sales across all of its business units.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM

  • Gold prices go on a FOMC-inspired run, up 2.2% to $1,701.40/oz. A dovish tone from the Fed and a...

    Gold prices go on a FOMC-inspired run, up 2.2% to $1,701.40/oz. A dovish tone from the Fed and a call that inflation is "subdued" has helped prop up the precious metal, according to commodity traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +2.8%) gets a lift from a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight,...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +2.8%) gets a lift from a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight, noting that potential earnings upside and a higher valuation could drive the shares up 16% or more.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • ILMN

    With Illumina (ILMN +44.8%) shares trading 23% above Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) $44.50/share hostile...

    With Illumina (ILMN +44.8%) shares trading 23% above Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) $44.50/share hostile bid price, investors clearly expect a better offer to arrive. Auriga (Buy) considers Roche's initial offer an "opportunistic" move spurred by Illumina's recent woes, and believes a stabilizing business will force Roche to make a higher bid. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +1.4%) is up a bit after delivering FQ3 results roughly in-line with the...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +1.4%) is up a bit after delivering FQ3 results roughly in-line with the company's revised guidance. Though RF Micro's FQ4 guidance is below Street forecasts (revenue of $185M and EPS of -$0.02 vs. consensus of $204.4M and $0.03), it looks as if the bad news is baked in. Cantor Fitzgerald (Buy) expects strong 3G/4G chip sales to offset the current weakness in 2G sales. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.2%) trades up after its Q4 beat expectations across the board. Despite...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.2%) trades up after its Q4 beat expectations across the board. Despite the earnings beat and today's price action, profit dipped 21% Y/Y as cardiac rhythm management sales declined due to concerns of overuse and a DOJ investigation. Like most of the industry, STJ continues to be challenged by pricing pressures from hospitals and more potential cuts in government health-care spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • PX

    Praxair (PX -3.8%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4, despite a surge in Y/Y earnings and...

    Praxair (PX -3.8%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4, despite a surge in Y/Y earnings and unveiling a $1.5B buyback program. Most of the impact comes from its cautious guidance as the company forecasts a downbeat 2012 due to negative currency impact, now expecting a profit of $1.33 - $1.38 for the year, below analysts estimates of $1.41.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • GWRE

    The CEO of the tech industry's first IPO of the year - Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) - says (video) the...

    The CEO of the tech industry's first IPO of the year - Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) - says (video) the firm's long-term revenue model will help keep it in a cash flow-positive status. Backed by U.S. Venture Partners and Bay Partners, the software maker for the property and casualty insurance market showed 19% Y/Y revenue growth to $172M in FY11. Shares +27.5% from their IPO price on day 1 of trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • PII

    Polaris Industries (PII +2.9%) regains early morning losses plus more after its Q4 earnings...

    Polaris Industries (PII +2.9%) regains early morning losses plus more after its Q4 earnings easily beat estimates. Profit jumped 17% Y/Y on the back of strong sales growth that surged ahead of expectations. However, the company warns the current quarter could see a greater impact from volatility of foreign currencies and higher input costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM

  • Stock indexes swing to slight gains following the Fed comments: Dow +0.1% at 12683,...

    Stock indexes swing to slight gains following the Fed comments: Dow +0.1% at 12683, S&P +0.1% to 1315, Nasdaq +0.7% to 2806. Yields on 10-year notes -7 bps to 1.991%. Euro turns up vs. the dollar; gold futures up $5.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • GD

    General Dynamics (GD -1.2%), which posted its Q4 report (I, II) before the open, falls a bit...

    General Dynamics (GD -1.2%), which posted its Q4 report (I, II) before the open, falls a bit after using its earnings call to establish a 2012 EPS guidance range of $7.10-$7.20, below a $7.57 consensus. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    US Airways Group (LCC +14.4%) racks up solid gains this morning after its Q4 EPS blows away...

    US Airways Group (LCC +14.4%) racks up solid gains this morning after its Q4 EPS blows away estimates. Net revenue was lower Y/Y due to a sizable jump in fuel costs, but still managed to easily beat estimates. The carrier's total revenue per available seat mile jumped 9.9% Y/Y, while its load factor rose to 81.9% from 80.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • BVSN

    E-commerce software firm BroadVision (BVSN -12.2%) is falling back to earth today, after...

    E-commerce software firm BroadVision (BVSN -12.2%) is falling back to earth today, after skyrocketing over the first 3 weeks of the year on relatively little news. BroadVision, which has been bleeding cash in recent quarters, reports earnings tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • TEX

    KeyBanc raises Terex (TEX +3.5%) to Buy from Hold, citing recent increases in architectural...

    KeyBanc raises Terex (TEX +3.5%) to Buy from Hold, citing recent increases in architectural billing and non-residential construction spending in conjunction with improved industry sentiment that suggests construction equipment manufacturers should enjoy an improving revenue environment in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • WRK

    MeadWestvaco (MWV -2.9%) trades lower on a mixed Q4 earnings report. Profit swung to a loss for...

    MeadWestvaco (MWV -2.9%) trades lower on a mixed Q4 earnings report. Profit swung to a loss for the quarter as weaker-than-expected demand in certain U.S. and European packaging markets hurt volume and production rates. The company also says it's still experiencing weak demand trends and significant inflation in certain raw materials, and expects Q1 to be below guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +6.6%) supply chain stocks ride the rocket from its big quarter: Chipmakers TriQuint...

    Apple (AAPL +6.6%) supply chain stocks ride the rocket from its big quarter: Chipmakers TriQuint (TQNT +3.4%) and Broadcom (BRCM +1.3%), and semiconductor designer Avago (AVGO +0.6%). Not benefiting is Synchronoss Technologies (SNCR -1%), whom Apple uses as its activation and provisioning software for both in-store and online sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKI-OLD

    Shares of Buckeye Technologies (BKI-OLD -8.2%) fall sharply during the course of the firm's...

    Shares of Buckeye Technologies (BKI-OLD -8.2%) fall sharply during the course of the firm's earnings CC (webcast) after the producer of cellulose-based products lowers Q3 EPS guidance to $0.69-$0.73 vs. $0.75 prior and $0.78 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • PJC

    Piper Jaffray (PJC -4.4%) trades lower after the firm swung to a loss in Q4 on a large...

    Piper Jaffray (PJC -4.4%) trades lower after the firm swung to a loss in Q4 on a large impairment charge and continued weak demand for capital markets services. Assets under management came in flat Y/Y and up 8.9% Q/Q largely due to equity market appreciation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • MOLX

    Molex (MOLX -6.8%) takes a hit after posting an FQ2 that missed estimates earlier this morning....

    Molex (MOLX -6.8%) takes a hit after posting an FQ2 that missed estimates earlier this morning. Profit declined 4.9% Y/Y due to the floods in Thailand. The company also guides Q3 lower on weaker than anticipated order rates and a reduced backlog, now expecting an EPS of $0.32 - $0.36 on revenues of $830M - $860M. The Street view is for an EPS of $0.39 on revenues of $872M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -17.6%) continues to tank following its FQ2 report, as soft gross margins...

    Fusion-io (FIO -17.6%) continues to tank following its FQ2 report, as soft gross margins overshadow healthy sales growth for the company's server flash memory subsystems, and the addition of Salesforce.com as a customer. Piper (Overweight) remains bullish on Fusion-io's growth potential, but thinks shares will be range-bound in the near-term, due to a Feb. 15 share lockup expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • JCP

    More on the new look from J.C. Penney (JCP -1.1%) (previous): CEO Ron Johnson says on an...

    More on the new look from J.C. Penney (JCP -1.1%) (previous): CEO Ron Johnson says on an earnings conference call (webcast) that he believes the new pricing initiative could triple sales in 2012 by improving the number of customer visits. He also notes that he likes the way Nordstrom does business in laying out justification for the new business model. Shares of JCP moved higher during the CC.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • RHHBY

    Roche’s (OTCQX:RHHBY) $5.7B hostile offer for Illumina (ILMN +43.1%) is built on a...

    Roche’s (OTCQX:RHHBY) $5.7B hostile offer for Illumina (ILMN +43.1%) is built on a loophole in ILMN’s takeover defenses: Roche will be able to vitiate ILMN’s provision for a staggered board by simply proposing to amend the by-laws at the next annual meeting to add another two Roche-sponsored directors, a scenario it completed successfully in its 2007 bid for Ventana.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.9%) unveils a major transformation plan including a new pricing structure...

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.9%) unveils a major transformation plan including a new pricing structure designed to draw in consumers. In essence, the retailer will offer fewer sales and more predictable pricing, in order to gain loyalty and avoid chasing hyperactive bargain hunters.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +15%) flying high after it provides guidance well above analyst forecasts. For the...

    Textron (TXT +15%) flying high after it provides guidance well above analyst forecasts. For the full year, the firm expects EPS of $1.80-$2 vs.consensus of $1.66, and revenues of $12.5B vs. $11.9B. (Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • INCB

    Shares of Indiana Community Bancorp (INCB +44.5%) soar after agreeing to be bought by Old...

    Shares of Indiana Community Bancorp (INCB +44.5%) soar after agreeing to be bought by Old National Bancorp (ONB -3.4%) in a $79M all-stock merger. Separately, INCB also reported Q4 earnings this morning, easily beating analysts' expectations as net charge-offs and loan losses dropped.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BMS

    Shares of Bemis (BMS +6.1%) power up a 5.5% gain after the firm knocked out a Q4 earnings beat....

    Shares of Bemis (BMS +6.1%) power up a 5.5% gain after the firm knocked out a Q4 earnings beat. The firm says that in 2012 it will use a facility consolidation program to cut costs and offset the anticipated lower demand for its packaging products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Rare earth miners, who had a difficult 2011 thanks to falling metal prices, are shooting higher...

    Rare earth miners, who had a difficult 2011 thanks to falling metal prices, are shooting higher today. Short-covering could be a factor: As of Dec. 30, Molycorp (MCP +6.6%), Avalon Rare Metals (AVL +3.8%), and Rare Element Resources (REE +6.5%) all had large chunks of their floats shorted.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    "Awe-inspiring," "stellar," "blowout" and "blockbuster,” are just some of the superlatives...

    "Awe-inspiring," "stellar," "blowout" and "blockbuster,” are just some of the superlatives gushing from the keyboards of analysts following Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) jaw-dropping (and there's one from us) FQ1. MarketBeat rounds up the love-fest as Ticonderoga's sets a "devilish" price target of $666, while Hudson's is $700. Shares +6.2% to $446.56. (earlier: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • HES

    Hess (HES -1.9%) dips after its Q4 EPS fell wide of the mark this morning, largely due to a...

    Hess (HES -1.9%) dips after its Q4 EPS fell wide of the mark this morning, largely due to a $525M loss tied to shutting down a refinery in the U.S. Virgin Islands and $236M in exploration expenses tied to dry hole costs for two wells in Indonesia. Production fell to 367K boe per day, down from 420K barrels over the same period last year.

  • J.D. Power sees U.S. vehicle sales picked up in January to reach 10.9M units - marking a 5.8%...
